sentences.sentence: With great activity, considering his bulk( 庞大的身躯 ), he sprang up the steps and squeezed through into the attic( 阁楼 ), and immediately afterwards( 之后 ) we heard his voice shouting that he had found the trap door( 通气门 ).
“He can find something,” remarked Holmes, shrugging( 耸 ) his shoulders. “He has occasional moments of reason.
As the French say, ‘The most inconvenient idiots( 傻瓜 ) are those who have a little intelligence!’ ”
“You see!” said Athelney Jones, coming down the steps again. “Facts are better than mere theories, after all.
My view of the case is confirmed. There is a trap door( 通气门 ) leading to the roof, and it is partly open.”
“It was I who opened it.”
“Oh, indeed! You did notice it, then?” He seemed a little disappointed. “Well, whoever noticed it, it shows how our gentleman got away. Inspector!”
“Yes, sir,” from the passage.
“Ask Mr. Sholto to step this way. Mr. Sholto, it is my duty to inform you that anything which you may say will be used against you.
I arrest you in the queen’s name as being concerned in the death of your brother.”
“There, now! Didn’t I tell you!” cried the poor little man, throwing out his hands, and looking from one to the other of us.
“Don’t trouble yourself about it, Mr. Sholto,” said Holmes. “I think that I can promise to clear you of( 证明你无罪 ) the charge.”
“Don’t promise too much, Mr. Theorist, don’t promise too much!” snapped( 厉声说 ) the detective. “You may find it a harder matter than you think.”
“Not only will I clear him, Mr. Jones, but I will make you a free present of the name and description of one of the two people who were in this room last night.
His name, I have every reason to believe, is Jonathan Small.
He is a poorly-educated man, small, active, with his right leg missing, and wearing a wooden stump( 假腿 ) which is worn away upon the inner( 靠内的 ) side.
His left boot has a coarse( 粗糙的 ), square-toed sole( 鞋底 ), with an iron band round the heel.
He is a middle-aged man, much sunburned( 晒黑的 ), and has been a convict( 囚犯 ).
These few indications may be of some assistance to you, coupled with the fact that there is a good deal of skin missing from the palm( 掌部 ) of his hand. The other man—”
“Ah! The other man?” asked Athelney Jones, in a sneering( 嘲笑 ) voice, but impressed none the less( 依然 ), as I could easily see, by the precision of the other’s manner.
“Is a rather unusual person,” said Sherlock Holmes, turning upon his heel. “I hope before very long to be able to introduce you to the pair of them. A word with you, Watson.”
He led me out to the head of the stair.
“All this,” he said, “has caused us rather to lose sight of the original purpose of our journey.”
“I have just been thinking so,” I answered. “It is not right that Miss Morstan should remain in this house.”

“No. You must escort( 护送 ) her home. She lives with Mrs. Cecil Forrester, in Lower Camberwell, so it is not very far. I will wait for you here if you will drive out again. Or perhaps you are too tired?”
“By no means. I don’t think I could rest until I know more of this business.
I have seen something of the rough side of life, but this quick succession( 一连串 ) of strange surprises tonight has shaken my nerve( 神经 ) completely.
I should like, however, to see the matter through with you, now that( 既然 ) I have got so far.”
“Your presence will be of great service to me,” he answered. “We shall work the case out( 破解这桩案件 ) independently, and leave this fellow Jones to come up with any theory he chooses.
When you have dropped Miss Morstan off( 把人送到地方 ), I would like you to go on to No. 3 Pinchin Lane, down near the water’s edge at Lambeth.
The third house on the right-hand side; Sherman is the name. Tell him—mentioning my name—that I want Toby at once, and bring Toby back with you.”
“A dog, I suppose.”
“Yes, an ugly dog, but with a most amazing sense of smell. I would rather have Toby’s help than that of the whole detective force of London.”
“I shall bring him, then,” said I. “It is one now. I ought to be back before three, if I can get a fresh horse.”
“And I,” said Holmes, “shall see what I can learn from Mrs. Bernstone, and from the Indian servant, who sleeps in the next attic( 阁楼 ).
Then I shall study the great Jones’s methods, and listen to his not too subtle( 含蓄的 ) insults( 侮辱 ).
As Goethe says, ‘People always mock( 嘲笑 ) what they cannot understand. ’ ”
The police had brought a cab with them, and in this I escorted( 护送 ) Miss Morstan back to her home.
After the angelic( 天使般的 ) fashion of( 以...的方式 ) women, she had borne trouble with a calm face as long as there was someone weaker than herself to support,
and I had found her bright and calm by the side of the frightened( 受惊的 ) housekeeper.
In the cab, however, she first turned faint( 快要昏厥 ), and then burst into( 突然迸发 ) a passion( 强烈情感 ) of weeping—so terribly had she been tested by the adventures of the night.
She has told me since that she thought me cold and distant upon that journey.
She little guessed the struggle within my breast, or the effort of self-restraint( 克制 ) which held me back.
My sympathies and my love went out to her, even as my hand had in the garden.
I felt that years of ordinary conventional life could not teach me to know her sweet, brave nature as had this one day of strange experiences.
Yet there were two thoughts which sealed the words of affection upon my lips.
She was weak and helpless, shaken in mind and nerve( 神经 ).
It was to take her at a disadvantage to thrust my love upon( 把我的爱强加于 ) her at such a time.
Worse still, she was rich.
If Holmes’s researches were successful, she would be an heiress( 女继承人 ).
Was it fair, was it honorable, that a half-pay surgeon( 军医 ) should take such advantage of( 占便宜 ) an intimacy( 亲近 ) which chance had brought about?
Might she not look upon me as a mere common fortune-seeker?
I could not bear to risk that such a thought should cross her mind.
This Agra treasure stood like an impassable barrier between us.

article_info.previous: 第一位嫌疑人不小心踩到了焦油，这一新发现足以使得Holmes他们找到嫌疑人的下落。终于警察赶到了现场，一位叫Athelney Jones的警探运用所谓的常理作出了他的一番推论，他认为是Mr. Thaddeus谋害了自己的孪生兄弟。
article_info.share_words: Not only will I clear him, Mr. Jones, but I will make you a free present of the name and description of one of the two people who were in this room last night. His name, I have every reason to believe, is Jonathan Small.

analysis: 文中Athelney Jones发现：“There is a trap door leading to the roof, and it is partly open.”然后Holmes说：“It was I who opened it.”因此答案选B。

question.cn: 当Mr. Thaddeus被捕时，Holmes说了些什么？
question.en: What did Holmes say when Mr. Thaddeus was arrested?

options.cn: 他认为Mr. Athelney Jones得出的是正确的结论。
options.en: He thought that Mr. Athelney Jones had drawn the right conclusion.

options.cn: 他同意Mr. Thaddeus犯了谋杀罪。
options.en: He agreed that Mr. Thaddeus was guilty of murder.

options.cn: 他会证明Mr. Thaddeus无罪并且找出真凶。
options.en: He would clear Mr. Thaddeus of the charge and find the real criminals.

analysis: 文中Holmes说道：“Not only will I clear him, Mr. Jones, but I will make you a free present of the name and description of one of the two people who were in this room last night.”因此答案选C。

question.cn: 根据Holmes的说法，以下有关Jonathan Small的表述正确的是？
question.en: According to Holmes, which of the following statements is CORRECT about Jonathan Small?

options.cn: 他年轻且受过良好的教育。
options.en: He was young and well educated.

analysis: 文中提到：“His name, I have every reason to believe, is Jonathan Small. He is a poorly-educated man, small, active, with his right leg missing, and wearing a wooden stump which is worn away upon the inner side. His left boot has a coarse, square-toed sole, with an iron band round the heel. ”因此答案选C。

question.en: What did Holmes ask Watson to do?

options.cn: 护送Miss Morstan回家然后去带一条狗回来。
options.en: To escort Miss Morstan home and bring back a dog.

options.cn: 询问Mrs. Bernstone和印度仆人有关这件事的情况。
options.en: To question Mrs. Bernstone and the Indian servant about the matter.

analysis: 文中提到：“You must escort her home. She lives with Mrs. Cecil Forrester, in Lower Camberwell, so it is not very far. . . When you have dropped Miss Morstan off, I would like you to go on to No. 3 Pinchin Lane, down near the water’s edge at Lambeth. The third house on the right-hand side; Sherman is the name. Tell him—mentioning my name—that I want Toby at once, and bring Toby back with you.”因此答案选A。

question.cn: 在回Miss Morstan家的途中，Watson怎么样？
question.en: How was Watson during the journey to Miss Morstan’s home?

options.cn: 他对Miss Morstan表现出极大热情。
options.en: He showed great enthusiasm to Miss Morstan.
He was struggling within his heart.

options.cn: 他昏倒了，然后又开始哭泣。
options.en: He turned faint and burst into weeping.

analysis: 文中提到：“She has told me since that she thought me cold and distant upon that journey. She little guessed the struggle within my breast, or the effort of self-restraint which held me back. ”因此答案选B。

share_title: 100天读完4本英文书，今天是第31天
